ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I think the course can be summarized as an excellent introduction to the study of corruption in its many forms, and the many approaches that have been used to study it. I would definitely recommend the course to anyone with an interest in corruption.
Yes. I found the course quite interesting and would recommend it to anyone even remotely interested in the topic of corruption.
Yes. Essential for those interested in the study of corruption.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course provided me with a much deeper understanding of corruption and the literature surrounding it. Already, work I have done for her course has engaged heavily with my intended dissertation project and the reading material has been extremely helpful in generating ideas for theoretical extensions and empirical projects.

I would say it deepened my knowledge somewhat, but not a ton. It helped develop knowledge related to a specific topic and area, but I'm not sure how much it developed knowledge of broader issues related to my discipline.
